perturbation.original_text: Party B must strictly comply with relevant industry laws, rules and standards promulgated by the State, including, without limitation, the PRC Telecommunications Regulations, Administrative Measures on Internet Information Service, Interim Provisions on the Administration of Internet Publishing, Interim Provisions on the Administration of Internet Websites' Engaging in News Publication Services, and such other laws, regulations, policies and industry management rules, and shall not distribute and disseminate illegal, unhealthy, reactionary information or advertisement or such other junk information on the Internet.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B should use reasonable efforts to comply with relevant industry laws, rules and standards promulgated by the State. Party B will try not to distribute illegal, unhealthy, reactionary information or advertisement or such other junk information on the Internet.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates strict compliance, while the modified version uses 'should use reasonable efforts,' which is ambiguous and weakens the obligation. There is no clear definition of what constitutes 'reasonable efforts.' Additionally, replacing 'shall not distribute' with 'will try not to distribute' makes the prohibition discretionary.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC Telecommunications Regulations and Administrative Measures on Internet Information Service, which require strict adherence to content restrictions.

perturbation.original_text: Party B shall make available to Party A the network access and authority for business inquiry and cancellation and upon the request of Party A, may provide such data/reports on user development, user classification, user habits and business outlook forecasts, and will convey to Party A in time the user files that may be required for management of such business to ensure the real-time update of Party A's user data room. At the same time, the Parties confirm that Party A shall have the ownership of the user files, and the user files and information shall belong to Party A's confidential information, for which Party B shall take the confidentiality obligation hereunder; Party B shall not use such information for any purposes other than those agreed herein without authorization, or provide such information to any third party in any manner whatsoever.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B may, from time to time, provide Party A with network access for business inquiry and cancellation, and as needed, may provide data/reports on user development, user classification, user habits and business outlook forecasts if readily available. Party A will have the ownership of user files, and Party B will endeavor to maintain the confidentiality of such user files, to the extent practicable. Party B will not intentionally use such information for unauthorized purposes or intentionally provide such information to third parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens Party B's obligation to provide data and ensure confidentiality. The phrases 'from time to time,' 'as needed,' 'if readily available,' 'to the extent practicable,' and replacing 'shall not' with 'will not intentionally' all introduce ambiguity and discretion. This makes it more difficult for Party A to enforce data provision and confidentiality requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: PRC Cybersecurity Law, which mandates specific data protection obligations and restrictions on data sharing without consent or legal basis.

perturbation.original_text: Party B guarantees to provide 24 hour non-interrupted system maintenance.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B will attempt to provide 24 hour system maintenance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a very clear guarantee, while the modified version uses 'will attempt,' which is ambiguous and weakens the obligation to merely trying to provide maintenance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, that obligates the compliance of contract terms.
